channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports

item.title: Report E-2024030108
item.description:
Report E-2024030108

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: MILAN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding a leaking metal drum containing hazardous product, DK 190 RL. The drum was leaking from the lid that would not properly secure. A Contractor cleaned-up the spilled product and attempted to secure the lid to stop the release. After several failed attempts, it was decided to overpack the drum and dispose of as waste. Additionally, one drain containing impacted oil dry and PPE was generated as waste, as well. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024030096
item.description:
Report E-2024030096

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding a punctured metal drum containing hazardous product, Onyxide 200. The drum was punctured by a pallet nail and released approximately 1-quart of product onto the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor cleaned-up the release using rags. The damaged drum was overpacked and the rags/ppe were containerized for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024030058
item.description:
Report E-2024030058

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN3349 Force 6.5G Insecticide release from (4) 40-pound cardboard boxes containing inner paper bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 cups of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the metal and wooden trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bags were collected along with all impacted PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024021916
item.description:
Report X-2024021916

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING AN AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THE PACKAGE HANDLER ALSO NOTICED THE SOUND OF DRY ICE PELLETS MOVING INSIDE THE BOX. RESPONDER INSPECTED AND FOUND APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD. THE OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED PERISHABLE AND FRAGILE WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM PA USING UPS ACCOUNT 853E2X, CHOANIES BAKERY, 605 HAZEL ST, LEBANON PA 17042. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK.

item.title: Report X-2024030101
item.description:
Report X-2024030101

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN THE NETHERLANDS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE PRODUCT LEAKING DUE TO THE CLOSURE BEING PRESSED DOWN BY OTHER PRODUCTS WITHIN THE PACKAGE. SOME ABSORBENT LINING WAS INSIDE THE PACKAGE WHICH HELPED CONTROL THE EXTENT OF LEAK OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS HAVE BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE NORMAL DISPOSAL PROCEDURES. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567JO, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.

ARRIVING RESPONDER WAS POINTED TOWARDS SEVERAL HAZMAT PACKAGES ON THE BELT AND WAS TOLD THERE WAS A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMING FROM ONE OF THE PACKAGES. SORTING THROUGH THE PACKAGES RESPONDER FOUND THIS HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT HAD A STRONG ODOR COMING FROM IT. OPENING THE PACKAGE FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND UPON FORTHER INSPECTION FOUND ONE OF THE CAPS TO BE EXTREMELY LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED SOME OF THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT AND WET THE INTERNAL CARDBOARD LAYER.

  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING AT 19:20 ON THE HVD OF THE PD-1 BELT IN THE EARTH CITY, MO UPS HUB. THE SPILLAGE WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. AN EXTERNAL INSPECTION SHOWED DENTED CORNERS. THE INTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED NO PACKING MATERIAL TO PROTECT THE INNER RECEPTICLES (1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES) FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS. ONE BOTTLE HAD A CRACKED CAP. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM.

item.title: Report X-2024030076
item.description:
Report X-2024030076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-24
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY A CLERK IN SMALL SORT WHO DETECTED A STRONG ODOR EMANATING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP FLOOR AND GIVEN TO A RESPONDER. UPON INSPECTION THE PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE ANY PHYSICAL SIGNS OF LEAKAGE BUT DID IN FACT SMELL STRONGLY OF SOLVENT. HAZMAT LABELLING ON THE PACKAGE FURTHER INDICATED THE PRODUCT INSIDE HAD BEEN COMPROMISED AND NEEDED TO BE CONTAINED IMMEDIATELY. PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND THE PRODUCT WAS CLEARLY HEAVILY SOILED FROM INTERNAL LEAKAGE, WHICH WAS MOSTLY CONTAINED VIA PLASTIC WRAPPING OVER PRODUCT, HOWEVER VAPOR WAS ESCAPING. PRODUCT WAS IMMEDIATELY BAGGED WITH LIQUIDS PRESENT TO PREVENT FURTHER VAPOR RELEASE.

Upon inspection the bottom of the box was wet because 4 bottles of Calci-Solve had loose caps and punctured seals causing minimal leakage. The 4 bottles of Calci-Solve were tightly packed with no inner protection. DescribePack: 4 gallons of Calci-Solve had loose caps and punctured seals causing them to leak. There was minimal leakage between all 4 gallons of Calci-Solve. All bottles of are still completely full. Total damage between the pallets is 15 Liters. The packages have been placed in salvage drums and held pending disposition from the shipper.

  • Description: 1. X-2024021663 During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans with positive closure rings, with bubble wrap for dunnage and inside of plastic bags. One of the two cans had a damaged bottom chime causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement. 2. X-2024021919 During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained three metal cans. The cans were all packaged with closure rings and inside of plastic bags. The ring and lid on one of the cans was not sealed causing the spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024030007
item.description:
Report E-2024030007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: Saint CLAIRSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIGAS PROPANE, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver of bobtail truck meets oncoming dump truck on narrow roadway and moves slightly to the right side to avoid striking mirrors. The rear tires of the bobtail truck leave the edge of the roadway and pulls the truck into the berm. Immediately after the oncoming truck passes the bobtail driver corrects his line of travel back up on the road surface. and crosses the left lane, out of control, and leaves the pavement into the ditch, striking a group of trees. During the impact, a section of piping for propane vapor on the rear of the bobtail is sheared off, resulting in a propane release. The driver was able to slow the leak at the cargo tank within 5 minutes by reseating the excess flow valve where the piping had been sheared off. A secondary bobtail truck responded to the scene and was able to safely empty the damaged bobtail by transferring the propane into the secondary truck. The damaged bobtail was towed to an impound lot that evening. The remaining propane vapor in the cargo tank was flared off the following day.

  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE APPEARED HEAVIER THAN THE 40 LB STATED WEIGHT ON THE THERMAL LABEL. ADDITIONALLY, THERE ARE TWO HANDHELD HOLES ON TWO SIDES OF THE U-HAUL HEAVY-DUTY BOX THAT ARE NOT SEALED. DURING SORTING PROCESS RIFLE AMMUNITION BEGAN FALLING OUT OF THE HANDHELD HOLES. RESPONDER INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND THE BOX WEIGHS 101 LBS AND CONTAINS SMALL ARMS AMMUNITION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS ARE CONTAINED INSIDE THE BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: When trailer was cleaned the tankwash missed putting a gasket in the discharge cap. Ecolab loaded the trailer and there was some product between the internal and external valves. The external valve wasn't tightened down well enough allowing product to get to the discharge cap. The discharge cap was missing the gasket inside which allowed the product to leak out on the ground. A response team was called in for clean up.

  • Description: On 2/7/2024 at approximately 1830, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4678718 at the ramp facility in Chicago, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consisted of 58 plastic jerricans, one of which showed evidence of spillage. Further investigation revealed that the jerrican in question had a loose closure, confirming spillage. The package was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had been improperly loaded into the trailer which caused the spill incident to occur by the packing becoming crushed. Once it was discovered, action was taken to isolate the scene from package handlers and to contain all damaged packages affected, including the culprit package within the hazmat processing area for further investigation and processing. DescribePack: Package had been poorly loaded into the trailer by the previous station, that the package had become crushed from the weight of the packages on top of it. One bottle had been crushed enough to be punctured and leak. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Effort was taken to mitigate the release effects by containing the damaged boxes and culprit hazmat in hazmat bags and totes and neutralizing the spill with an absorbent spill aid.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived at Hazmat cage with signs of damages during the day sort. The contents were inspected and two of the contents showed signs of leakage. One of the plastic bottle caps as missing, and said bottle was empty. The other loose cap was tightened to prevent further leakage. The remaining contents were placed in a lined salvage drum awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The Failure of the package was due to lose caps, with one cap missing. Together with the empty bottle, approximately 1/8 of the contents from another bottle leaked out. No holes or punctures were found. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: All lose caps were tightened and contents were placed in lined salvage drum to prevent further damages.

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY AN AIR PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING. RESPONDER INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND THE SOURCE OF THE LEAK TO BE ONE GALLON OF EPOXYSTARZ EXPERT GRADE METALLIC EPOXY SYSTEM, PART B WITH GHS PICTOGRAMS ON THE CONTAINER. THE CONTAINER LEAKED DUE TO HAVING A POOR SEAL AROUND THE TOP FROM A WARPED LID. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR SERVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT 0VE277, SN CONSOLIDATION, 193 LAUREL FOREST CIRCLE, ATLANTA GA 30342.

DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Contents were put into a tote with hazmat liner to contain the corrosive contents that were leaking from the bottles.

  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down belt appearing undamaged, but appeared to begin leaking slightly from corners of box after being scanned to truck. Package was isolated from sort and QA called to inspect. Package was then found to be an unlabeled and damaged hazmat. DescribePack: Outer package appears fully undamaged, with no tears/punctures/abrasions, but is leaking paint from corners and edges. 1 item in package is dented, likely via weight of other item inside; outer packaging appears sufficient for items within, but inner packaging and blocking is inadequate. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When damage was first suspected, package was removed from the van line and placed into a black non-hazmat bin lined with a plain plastic bag liner. Leak only escaped package after it was brought to van line to be loaded, so was mostly contained within box. Upon inspection, package was found to contain 2 hazmat items, and was moved to a red hazmat bin with plastic hazmat bag liner.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station, then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: Contents are Increte High Performance Epoxy Part A and Part B. Both cans leaked from loose lids. The Part B is the hazardous one and it leaked approximately 5 ounces. Part A is non hazardous and it released approximately 5 ounces too. Both cans had paint clips. Insufficient bubble wrap was used. Too much empty space was left inside the box. Part B size is 40 ounces and Part A size is 80 ounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival of the wet package, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 10-gallons of ENILEX NI-5A Corrosive Liquid, n.o.s (UN1760, 8, III) released from (2) 5-gallon pails. The release was caused by a puncture from a pallet due to a load shift. The release impacted a 53’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor, the side of the trailer, and a 60’ x 1’ area of asphalt. E3 Environmental was able to neutralize and clean the release with absorbents, and the proper PPE. The remaining cargo was shrink wrapped, restacked, and secured for transit along with the overpack. All waste was containerized in (3) 55-gallon poly drums, which was then taken offsite by the E3 Environmental for proper disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 29, 2024, at 0645 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal USB experienced a release of UN1866 “Orthophthalic Resin” from a 55-gallon metal drum. On February 29, 2024, at 0714 ET, XPO Logistics retained Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) to complete all regulatory reporting. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct all on site cleanup activities. On February 29, 2024, at 0920 EST, contractors arrived on site. They confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and the impacted pallet wood were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was then staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

First Call Environmental personnel transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote and shredded the damaged poly tote and containerized it into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024021587

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: UNIONDALE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN NASSAU, NEW YORK, SMOKE WAS OBSERVED EMITTING FROM A ONE POUND FIBERBOARD BOX. EMPLOYEES WERE EVACUATED FROM THE AREA AND THE PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED OUTSIDE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS VISIBLE ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS AN APPLIED LABEL STATING "DO NOT THROW AWAY THIS BOX. PLEASE PLACE THE CAMERA BACK IN THIS BOX AFTER REMOVING IT FROM THE WALL". "KEPLER ANALYTICS" IS ALSO INDICATED ON ONE SIDE OF THE BOX. THE EVENT HAS CAUSED ONE SIDE OF THE BOX TO HAVE A BURN HOLE WITH SCORCH MARKS SURROUNDING. THERE ARE VISIBLE CHAR AND SCORTCH MARKS ON ANOTHER SIDE OF THE BOX. INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENT REVEALS SOME TYPE OF CAMERA WITH AN UNKNOWN BATTERY SOURCE THAT IS ALMOST ENTIRELY DESTROYED. PRIOR TO THE INCIDENT, THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM FT LAUDERDALE (FLL) TO LOUISVILLE (SDF) TO NEW YORK (JFK). AS REQUIRED PER 171.15 A TELEPHONE NOTICE WAS MADE TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER (NRC). REPORT NUMBER 1392059.

  • City: DANVILLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 23, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3266 had a faulty valve and released approximately one hundred (100) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indian Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums. Crews transferred the product from the damaged 275-gallon tote into a new one 275-gallon tote. Crews cut up the damaged tote and placed the contents into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

The wet leaking pkg with no Hazmat markings and no orientation arrows required for pkgs containing liquids was placed in an unlined unauthorized plastic bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Loose trigger spray heads in 3 x 16 ounces plastic bottles allowed liquid to leak staining and wetting the contents leaking through a thin plastic bag and wetting the repack box as well. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed in a bin.

  • Description: On February 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3267 was damaged in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the pallet, trailer, and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE crews deployed a neutralizing solution to the impacted areas until a neutral pH was confirmed. Granular absorbents were deployed and worked in with hand tools. The undamaged cargo was repalletized for transport with the driver back to the Wilmington, OH terminal. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon overpack drum, and all UN3267-impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. All generated waste was staged on-site.

  • City: FITCHBURG

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: A Veolia employee was at the customer site loading flammable liquid into the tanker truck. Once the truck was loaded, the Veolia driver communicated to the customer that the loading process was complete. While shutting down the pumping operations the customer did not follow the proper shutdown sequence and prematurely closed the internal valve on the tank the flammable liquid was pumped from. This action increased the pressure on the vapor recovery line and resulted in blowing the line off the valve of the tank truck releasing a mist of flammable liquid.

  • Description: On February 22, 2024, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a HEPA vacuum to collect all free-standing product. The contents of the vacuum, the damaged bags, and all UN3378 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The drum was properly labeled, and possession of the material was taken by RLC to be disposed of through their bulk waste stream.

THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA, USA USING UPS ACCOUNT AH1976, SPHNIX COSMETICS, 800 S BROOKHURST ST, SUITE 2D, ANAHEIM CA 92804.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-25
  • City: MUNDS PARK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TITAN TRANSFER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0825 ET Titan Transfer Inc. contacted ERTS to request assistance with cleaning a 8 gallon release of UN1210-INK- PMC031 DK GRN SDA3C. It was reported the release was coming from a vehicle impacting concrete located on I-17 Munds Park AZ USA at the Christensen Rest Area (Southbound; Mile Marker #32). At 1248 EST, Graymar arrived on site and located the release. At 1320 EST, Graymar confirmed an estimated 8 gallons of PMC031D5 Dark Green SDA3C released. No drains or waterways were impacted. Newell Technologies, confirmed the product is flammable as a liquid, but once solidified, it is non-hazardous. GrayMar used absorbents, worked it into the impact, collected and placed into one 55-gal poly drum. The contractor will transport the one drum of spent absorbents to the contractor's shop. The impacted 15 gallon pail of product was placed into an overpack and placed onto the trailer as salvage material.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN2491 was damaged in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the ethanolamine solution-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed into one (1) 95-gallon poly overpack. All waste was staged on site for transport and disposal.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T00:27:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being off loaded from a trailer when it was dropped, and the container was punctured causing a leak. Cardboard and absorbent were placed down to absorb the liquid and the pail was placed inside a salvage drum. DescribePack: The container has a nickel size puncture hole on the side of it where it was dropped.. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as the liquid started to appear on the floor cardboard and absorbent were placed down. The container was immediately placed inside a salvage drum.

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A bottle of wheel and tire cleaner with no cap, leaked inside of the package causing outer packaging to fail. And that led to the discovery of the undeclared HAZMATs inside the packag. No leakage from the HAZMAT its self. DescribePack: Two sides of the package fell apart due to internal leakage, causing the sides of the package to disintegrate. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: No actions were needed.

item.title: Report X-2024021719
item.description:
Report X-2024021719

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T00:31:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: PEARL
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was being unloaded and QA was called to retrieve the package, package was put in a red tote and taken to the Hazmat area to be processed. DPR was done and awaiting the disposition. DescribePack: the tops were loose and contents wasted out. The can had clamps on it, but paint still seeped through the lid. They were 1 gallon aluminum cans. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA pushed the lids back down, placed them in a drum packed properly with plastic bags and etc.
